page.title: 03Mr. D. Tutill's day
page.content: He usually wakes up at around 5.45am and goes into the bathroom.He comes downstairs and has his breakfast.At 6.30am he walks to Farncombe station and catches the train to Waterloo.When the train arrives there he walks to catch a bus to the Thames Water offices.A nice hot cup of coffee is always welcome when he arrives.He starts work which includes organising what other people are going to do,writing reports and other paper work,talking on the telephone,using a computer,attending meetings and lots of other things.He usually leaves at about 5.45pm to catch the 6.20 train home.This means arriving home at 7.15pm and having some tea.For the rest of the evening he reads,watches TV or some similar activity.At about 10.15 he goes to bed.
